titlestmt.titleproper: Rockefeller University records, Rockefeller University Press, Journals Department, Studies
A Guide to the Rockefeller University records, Rockefeller University Press, Journals Department, Studies FA922

did.unittitle: Rockefeller University records, Rockefeller University Press, Journals Department, Studies

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements note
phystech.p: Materials requiring specialized equipment for access (film, audio, video, slides) may be closed to research dependent on availability of the applicable equipment
Brittle or damaged items, or materials otherwise in need of preservation care, may be closed to researchers at the discretion of the RAC Head of Archival Services/Head of Reference.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation note
prefercite.p: Information regarding the Rockefeller Archive Center's preferred elements and forms of citation can be found at http://www.rockarch.org/research/citations.php

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open for scholarly research.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials
separatedmaterial.p: All volumes relocated to RAC Library.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Studies from the Rockefeller Institute for Medical Research v. 1-158 (1904-1959), Vol. 6 has addresses of dedication, May 11, 1906 printed in full, Vol. 17, 1912 and later Studies are reprinted before binding.
Cumulative indexes: v. 1-25 author and subject (1904-1916), v. 26-50 author and subject (1917-1924), v. 51-116 author only (1924-1940).
Set is labeled "Founder's Set" and early volumes bear book plate of John D. Rockefeller, Jr. and Abby Rockefeller.
Volume 7 is NOT included in the collection.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials
separatedmaterial.p: All volumes relocated to RAC Library.
